intro: Linanthus aureus, commonly known as the golden linanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Evening Primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its stems are erect and branching. Linanthus aureus is an annual herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
